str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
Bread, a loaf, food. From airo; bread or a loaf.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From eucharistos; to be grateful, i.e. to express gratitude; specially, to say grace at a meal.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To break (in pieces), break bread. A primary verb; to break.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.
Strengthened for a primary edo; used only in certain tenses, the rest being supplied by phago; to eat.
